Custom Formula Fields are used to perform calculations and generate values based on other fields within the same object. They cannot directly reference fields or data from related objects. Custom Formula Fields can reference other formula fields, standard fields, and custom fields within the same object to derive their values. However, they are limited to calculations and referencing fields within the current object only.

Custom Formula fields

Formula fields are read only
Accessible via the Force.com SOAP API
The values are calculated every time they are needed; they are not stored
Formula fields also let you set dynamic default values for new records
Formulas are also used in validation rules to ensure business requirements are met and data quality is maintained
Use to enforce other business rules, including Workflow Rules, Approval Processes, Approval Steps, Assignment Rules, Escalation Rules, Auto-Response Rules.
Formula fields may reference other formula fields
Formula fields reference fields from child to parent objects
Are not searchable
Can’t reference text area long fields
Can reference standard fields or custom fields
Cannot add multiple records together
